content: For sometime now, a friend of mine has being on YouTube, trying to find any legit site for mining btc. I have told him times without number that it will be hard to find such site but he still persist. comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: Justtoons on March 03, 2023, 07:56:00 AMSo I'm asking today if there's any legit btc cloud mining platform so I can help my friend with?He should stay away from cloud mining if he wants to stay away from being scammed. There is nothing better than joining a mining pool with his miners but which are expensive and consuming electricity too. If his mining research is not about getting miners and to join a mining pool, he should not try to mine bitcoin, he can just buy bitcoin and hold it for long instead.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: Justtoons on March 03, 2023, 07:56:00 AMSo I'm asking today if there's any legit btc cloud mining platform so I can help my friend with?From what I've seen, there aren't any cloud mining platforms that are both legit and profitable, so be wary of any that promise guaranteed returns or seem too good to be true. There have been a ton of scams and Ponzi schemes in the cloud mining space, so a lot of platforms that seem like they'd be profitable are actually just trying to scam you. It's important to be super careful and do your research before investing any money into one of these platforms.

comments.body: Most cloud mining sites are scams but if this is for the sake of your friend's youtube and for studying purposes and willing to lose investment then alternatively for Cloud mining I suggest check Nicehash marketplace where you can rent hash rate and miningrigrentals.com are the two that I know still legit. I don't know if there are other cloud mining sites out there legit but those two are known as cloud mining that sells hash rate but still, there is a risk involved and I can't guarantee that they won't cheat(fraud).Why not encourage your friend to buy an ASIC unit than invest in Cloud mining buying then mine with your own is way more safer than finding a legit cloud mining sites.

comments.body: Look at old bitcoin mining statistics and find modern statisticshttps://www.911metallurgist.com/blog/the-cost-to-mine-different-cryptocurrencies-in-every-countryThen try to answer the question, what is the cost of mining for your company and what will they do after the halving if the price of bitcoin does not rise.Better buy bitcoin now. comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: noorman0 on March 06, 2023, 03:11:01 AMThat means, youtube influencers do their job well.~snip~If someone wants to gain knowledge about something exclusively on social networks, then he has to face the fact that sooner or later he will fall into a trap. All these influencers are trying to earn something, so even though not all of them have bad intentions, the fact is that they lead many astray. Bitcoin mining used to be possible on personal computers, and it is possible today - the difference, of course, is that it is no longer profitable at all. This message should be clearly conveyed to people, with a note that cloud mining is only one form of deception that will only generate losses in 99% of cases, and in only 1% of cases will they return the invested amount or earn minimally.As strange as it may seem, even with the use of faucets in a smart way, someone can earn $1 a day, which is of course a small amount, but still you have $30 at the end of the month.

comments.author: kelonmusk
comments.body: In my opinion, it's always best to be cautious when it comes to cloud mining. I think it's important to approach cloud mining with a healthy dose of skepticism and to do your due diligence before investing any money. I suggest that your friend do some research and read reviews from other users before investing any money. It's also important to consider the fees and potential returns on investment.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: kelonmusk on March 13, 2023, 02:17:49 PMIn my opinion, it's always best to be cautious when it comes to cloud mining. I think it's important to approach cloud mining with a healthy dose of skepticism and to do your due diligence before investing any money. Since cloud mining is in 99.99% cases straight up scam, there's really no need to read reviews and waste time looking for a legit ones. Instead, just treat them like they are ponzi schemes (meaning avoid them) and buy bitcoin & store it safely.
